Tanky, health stacking builds are significantly nerfed for both champions. I don't feel like going through all the math but the break even point for damage on both champs requires a far greater amount of bonus AD than their current meta builds give them. The break even point for Yi is something like 175 bonus AD IIRC.

Some dude did a math on Yi's E, seems like he need to build ~2 more offensive items to deal the same damage so yeah.
But Fiora's passive got nerf just by...1%. and no longer scale with level, now get max scaling at level 1.
I don't think that's gonna hurt her much, or even at all.

By the time you have enough AD for the max scaling to make up for the 1% base that was lost, you're almost always going to have been past the level (lvl 8) where your passive would have had 3.5% base before. For reference, the break even point at lvl 1 is .028X+3%=.045x+2%. X=59. That means the break even point at lvl 1 is 59 bonus AD, which is obviously impossible. The break even point at lvl 8 is 100 bonus AD. Any point beyond lvl 8 is a straight nerf no matter how much AD you have. So yes, it's a nerf all around no matter how you look at it, especially early. Her 8-13 is also significantly weaker as well since they cut the utility scaling on her E which she maxes second. And they heavily nerfed Titanic Hydra as well. And Tiamat is now a weaker powerspike than before.

No. It's a power neutral change if you actually built damage and a straight nerf if you built tank.

Because Fiora and Yi need actual incentives to buy damage, if they don't do that then you are stuck being a terrible bulky champion AND a terrible damage dealer regardless of what they buy. For instance, say no compensation is ever administered and Yi builds the same things he does now after direct nerfs to this build. He would proceed to do mediocre damage and just be a bulky champion with no CC, aka basically useless. Scenario 2 with no compensation is this Yi is tired of doing no damage so he goes for a damage build. In this scenario since they trashed his bases (aimed at tank build) and didn't touch ratios his damage is now still PRETTY garbage, but he now dies the second he gets CC'ed since he built damage, aka basically useless.

Viktor received 1 nerf to E recently and yes, it did hit his waveclear, but he can still waveclear if ahead and burst people like before. Viktor wasn't breaking any "rules" in the game and still scales extremely well, but has to buy a bit more early AP if you REALLY want that 1 E clear the entire wave (which was a tad bit rediculous tbh). Viktor was designed as a bursty wavecleary mage that cleared waves and killed people if they were caught out. He did that and thus, only received a nerf because he did it a little TOO well and can still theoretically do it with a bit more AP. Yi/Fiora on the other hand were designed as "light fighters" that have high mobility and shred your back line if you let them, but die relatively easily when focused. They do most of this, but they do it without the downside of "die relatively easily when focused" part since they do enough damage with low items and can just for 2 damage+4 tank items. Hitting bases stops this scenario, but makes it so they can now die easily when focused, but also make it so they cannot even kill their targets WITH damage items so it is a complete lose-lose and the champion is now trash tier. This is why scalings were buffed to make it so they can still DO their job at dealing damage. Viktor didn't need a scaling buff because he still kills people since his common build allowed him to do so regardless of his bases since his scalings are already pretty f*cking good. Viktor was a case of "I will blow you up after I get 2 items", but was guaranteed those 2 items since E made getting gold a trivial concept since it was guaranteed to clear waves (or atleast the casters) early on regardless if you were 0/2 or 3/0.
